result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew R Strike was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
-Costs to be paid as a condition of probation. 
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

-Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are prescribed. 
-No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packages, or distributed.

-No violent contact with Victim.
-Domestic violence counseling through the State certified batterers intervention program. 
-Attend anger management.
-If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew R Strike

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty. Angela Wang advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 10:12 AM
Attorney Shawn N Woller in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Angela Wang in court for Matthew R Strike.  
Defendant Matthew R Strike in court.  
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Count 1 is dismissed and read-in.
Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to Count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 2.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.

COUNT 2
Court orders the following:
SENTENCE IS WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  1 YEAR
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.'s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No violent contact with:  victim
Domestic Violence Counseling through a State certified batterers intervention program
Anger Management
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed

Costs:  $243.00
Domestic Abuse Surcharge:  $100.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

Felony warning, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
filed by the State

NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.addlTxt: appointing Attorney Angela Wang
Hearing on February 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:45 AM Defendant Matthew R Strike in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on February 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  If DNA sample has not been taken from the defendant, the Court orders sample to be taken;  and it may be expunged under 165.77(4) Wis. Statutes.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A/Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.   Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

01:32 PM Defendant Matthew R Strike in court.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 17, 2022 at 10:00 am.
